titleInfo.title: ‘File 7/32 Use of Muharraq aerodrome and other RAF aerodromes by U.S.A.A.F. [United States Army Air Forces]’

physicalDescription.extent: The file is arranged in approximate chronological order, from the earliest items at the front of the file to the latest at the end. Circled index numbers written using blue/red crayon can be found throughout the file, and refer to the office notes at the end of the file (folios 11-12).

Foliation: The foliation sequence begins on the front cover and ends on the last folio, using pencil numbers written in the top-right corner of the recto side of each folio. The following foliation anomalies occur: 1, and 1A.

mods.abstract: The papers in the file concern the British Government’s decision to permit United States military aircraft use of British military airfields around the world. Correspondence exchanged principally between the Political Resident (Lieutenant-Colonel William Rupert Hay), the Bahrain Political Agent (Cornelius James Pelly) and the Sharjah Residency Agent (Jasim bin Muhammad Kadmari) discuss the question of landing fees for foreign aircraft at Bahrain and Sharjah, noting that US (and French) military aircraft are exempted from such charges.
